samp_mat_process: filtered through 47 mm diameter 0.2 micrometer pore size polycarbonate membrane filters (Whatman Cyclopore) with bottle-top filtration units attached to vacuum pump
collection_method: Surface water samples were collected by CTD rosette water sampler on 24. Jul. 2018 during RV POLARSTERN expedition PS114 in Fram Strait at station PS114_36-4 near oceanographic mooring ‘R5’ that is part of AWI’s FRAM mooring array. Water from several CTD bottles triggered at 5m water depth was mixed and 1 L aliquots (i.e., technical replicates) were filtered through 47mm polycarbonate disc filters with 0.2 micrometer pore size for later distribution to participants of the GLOMICON intercomparison study
title: 18S amplicon metabarcoding GLOMICON comparison (AWI)
seq_facility: Alfred Wegener Institute Bremerhaven, Germany, Polar Biological Oceanography
pcr_primer_forward: 5'-GCG GTA ATT CCA GCT CCA A-3'
pcr_primer_reverse: 5'-AC TTT CGT TCT TGA TYR R-3'
pcr_primer_reference:
528F: Elwood et al. (1985) doi:10.1093/oxfordjournals.molbev.a 
040362; 964iR: Balzano et al. (2015) doi:10.3354/ame01740
notes_sampling: Surface waters from the northern part of Fram Strait, the only deep connection between the Atlantic Ocean and the central Arctic
design_description: DNA was extracted from filters with the NucleoSpin Plant II kit from Macherey-Nagel following the manufacturer’s protocol (July 2014/Rev. 09). DNA was diluted in 2 x 30 microliter of elution buffer. The V4 region of the 18S rRNA gene was amplified using the primer set 528F (5’-GCG GTA ATT CCA GCT CCA A-3’) and 964iR (5’-AC TTT CGT TCT TGA TYR R-3’). The PCR mixture contained 12.5 microliter 2x KAPA HiFi HotStart ReadyMix (Roche), 5 microliter of each primer (concentration: 1 micromole / L) and 2.5 microliter of template DNA. Reactions conditions in an Eppendorf Mastercycler: initial denaturation (95°C, 180 s), 25 denaturation cycles (95°C, 30 s), annealing (55°C, 30 s), 2 x extension (72°C, 30 s and 72°C, 300 s). The amplicons were purified with AMPure XP beads (Beckmann Coulter). Dual indices and Illumina sequencing adapters were attached in an Index PCR using the Nextera XT Index Kit (Illumina) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. The library was finally cleaned with AMPure XP beads (Beckmann Coulter).

title: 18S amplicon metabarcoding GLOMICON comparison (SBR)
pcr_primer_reference: TAReuk454FWD1 (5’-CCAGCASCYGCGGTAATTCC-3’) and TAReukREV3 (5’-ACTTTCGTTCTTGATYRA-3’) (Stoeck et al., 2010, doi: 10.1111/j.1365-294X.2009.04480.x)
pcr_cond: initial denaturation at 98°C for 30 seconds, followed by 12 cycles of denaturation at 98°C for 10 seconds, annealing at 53°C for 30 seconds and extension at 72°C for 30 s, and 18 cycles of denaturation at 98°C for 10 seconds, annealing at 48°C for 30 seconds and extension at 72°C for 30 seconds, and a final extension at 72°C for 10 min
design_description:
DNA was extracted from filters with the NucleoSpin Plant II kit from Macherey-Nagel following the manufacturer’s protocol (July 2014/Rev. 09). DNA was diluted in 2 x 30 microliter of elution buffer. The V4 region of the 18S rRNA gene was amplified using the primer set  TAReuk454FWD1 (5’-αCCAGCASCYGCGGTAATTCC-3’) (Stoeck et al., 2010) and TAReukREV3  (5’-βACTTTCGTTCTTGATYRA-3’) (Stoeck et al., 2010). For this primer set, α and β represent the two Illumina overhanging adapter sequences (CTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCTTCCGATCT and GGAGTTCAGACGTGTGCTCTTCCGATCT, for α and β, respectively) allowing the construction of amplicon libraries by a two step PCR.
